HARISHKUMAR.K.P, RESIDING AT UNAKKUR KAVIL HOUSE, THANKAYAM, SOUTH THRIKARIPUR VILLAGE, HOSDURG TALUK, R2 BY ADV. SMT.G.SANGEETHA R1 BY PUBLIC PROSECUTOR SRI.ALEX M.THOMBRA THIS CRIMINAL MISC. CASE HAVING COME UP FOR ADMISSION ON 07-12-2017, THE COURT ON THE SAME DAY PASSED THE FOLLOWING: ms eto EC) ae 2017/KER/49567 Crl.MC.No. 8159 of 2017 () APPENDIX PETITIONER(S)' EXHIBITS ANNEXURE Al THE TRUE CERTIFIED COPY OF THE FIR IN CRIME NO.594/2015 OF CHANDERA POLICE STATION, KASARAGOD DISTRICT. ANNEXURE A2 THE TRUE CERTIFIED COPY OF THE FINAL REPORT IN CRIME NO.594/2015 OF CHANDERA POLICE STATION, KASARAGOD DISTRICT. ANNEXURE A3 THE AFFIDAVIT DATED 31/10/2017 SWORN IN BY THE 2ND RESPONDENT. RESPONDENT'S EXHIBITS: NIL TRUE COPY PA TO JUDGE Scl. 2017/KER/49567 B. KEMAL PASHA, J. Dated this the 7 day of December, 2017 ORDER Petitioner is the accused in Crime No.594 of 2015 of Chandera Police Station, which is now pending as C.C.No.2690 of 2015 of the Judicial First Class Magistrate's Court-I, Hosdurg, registered for the offences punishable under Sections 341, 323 and 324 r/w Section 34 of the Indian Penal Code. 2. It seems that the matter has been amicably settled between the parties. 3. On going through the facts and circumstances of the case, it seems that the matter can be permitted to be settled. 4. It has been reported that no criminal antecedents have been reported against the petitioner. The second respondent has filed Annexure-A3 affidavit affirming that the matter has been amicably settled between him and the petitioner and he has no complaints against the petitioner. Considering the fact that the matter has already been settled pea 2017/KER/49567 Cril.M.C. No.8159 of 2017 -~2- amicably between the parties, this court is satisfied that no purpose would be served in proceeding with the trial of the case. Matters being so, all further proceedings in C.C.No.2690 of 2015 of the Judicial First Class Magistrate's Court-I, Hosdurg in Crime No.594 of 2015 of Chandera Police Station, against the petitioner, are liable to be quashed. In the result, this Crl.M.C. is allowed and all further proceedings in C.C.No.2690 of 2015 of the Judicial First Class Magistrate's Court-I, Hosdurg in Crime No.594 of 2015 of Chandera Police Station, against the petitioner, are hereby quashed. Sd/- B.KEMAL PASHA JUDGE Scl/07.12.2017
